column4: Unable to mount the volume 'UDF Volume'. disk works fine in vista machine
any help?
Unable to mount the volume 'UDF Volume'. disk works fine in vista machine, any help?
How about more details? How are you trying to mount it?
Sorry, can't help you with that. Maybe someone else can...
I assume you can open it fine in Vista? Do all of your other CDs open OK in ubuntu?
my ubuntu 8.04 installation disk works
Did you mention what it was you burned to disk in Vista? I didn't catch that... was it data/sound/video or what?
burned to disk in vista yes, and it's data
Wait a minute--isn't UDF the filesystem for DVD disks? Is your disk CD or DVD?
CD

Are you able to read any older CDs in Ubuntu that have the UDF filesystem? I'm wondering if it has something to do with Vista using the latest UDF standard, because Mac OS X has some problems with it, so maybe Ubuntu does too.
That's understandable! :) But to get more clues as possible, try as many other CDs as you can to see if it is just a problem with the Vista written disk.
okay
give me a second, I'm burning another disk with magicISO after RAR the files. I have to go in closet to get some old disk, I usual use I Ipod to transfer files
I found a old CD I burned using XP, to put LINKSYS drivers on it, and it mounted fine
then you're right it's Vista
them Microsoft Bastards!!!!!
their sound be a fix for this soon, right?
Interesting, yes maybe it's a vista issue. You may have to post/search the ubuntuforums.org to see if there is any info that will help you.
will do
